title: Declaration of Independence
description: The Continental Congress adopts the Declaration of Independence, declaring the thirteen American colonies independent from Great Britain.

title: Constitutional Convention
description: Delegates meet in Philadelphia to draft the United States Constitution, creating the framework for American government.

title: George Washington Inaugurated
description: George Washington becomes the first President of the United States, establishing the executive branch of government.

title: Louisiana Purchase
description: The United States purchases the Louisiana Territory from France, doubling the size of the nation.

title: War of 1812 Begins
description: The United States declares war on Great Britain, fighting over maritime rights and territorial expansion.

title: Missouri Compromise
description: Congress passes legislation admitting Missouri as a slave state and Maine as a free state, maintaining the balance of power.

title: Mexican-American War Begins
description: The United States declares war on Mexico over territorial disputes, resulting in significant territorial gains.

title: Gold Rush Begins
description: Gold is discovered at Sutter's Mill in California, triggering a massive migration westward.

title: Civil War Begins
description: Confederate forces fire on Fort Sumter, marking the beginning of the American Civil War.

title: Emancipation Proclamation
description: President Abraham Lincoln issues the Emancipation Proclamation, declaring all slaves in Confederate states to be free.

title: Civil War Ends
description: General Robert E. Lee surrenders at Appomattox Court House, ending the Civil War.

title: Lincoln Assassinated
description: President Abraham Lincoln is assassinated by John Wilkes Booth at Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C.

title: Transcontinental Railroad Completed
description: The first transcontinental railroad is completed, connecting the eastern and western United States.

title: Spanish-American War
description: The United States declares war on Spain, resulting in American control of Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines.

title: US Enters World War I
description: The United States declares war on Germany, entering World War I on the side of the Allies.

title: Women's Suffrage
description: The 19th Amendment is ratified, granting women the right to vote nationwide.

title: Stock Market Crash
description: The Wall Street Crash of 1929 triggers the Great Depression, the worst economic downturn in American history.

title: Pearl Harbor Attack
description: Japan launches a surprise attack on Pearl Harbor, bringing the United States into World War II.

title: Atomic Bombs Dropped
description: The United States drops atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, leading to Japan's surrender and the end of World War II.

title: Korean War Begins
description: The United States enters the Korean War to support South Korea against North Korean and Chinese forces.

title: Brown v. Board of Education
description: The Supreme Court rules that racial segregation in public schools is unconstitutional.

title: March on Washington
description: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his 'I Have a Dream' speech at the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom.

title: Kennedy Assassinated
description: President John F. Kennedy is assassinated in Dallas, Texas, shocking the nation.

title: Civil Rights Act
description: President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Civil Rights Act, prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

title: Voting Rights Act
description: Congress passes the Voting Rights Act, eliminating barriers that prevented African Americans from voting.

title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
description: Neil Armstrong becomes the first human to walk on the moon, achieving a major milestone in the space race.

title: Watergate Scandal
description: President Richard Nixon resigns following the Watergate scandal, the only U.S. president to do so.

title: Berlin Wall Falls
description: The Berlin Wall falls, symbolizing the end of the Cold War and the reunification of Germany.

title: Gulf War
description: The United States leads a coalition to liberate Kuwait from Iraqi occupation.

title: September 11 Attacks
description: Terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center and Pentagon kill nearly 3,000 people, changing American foreign policy.

title: Financial Crisis
description: The collapse of Lehman Brothers triggers a global financial crisis and the Great Recession.

title: Barack Obama Inaugurated
description: Barack Obama becomes the first African American president of the United States.

title: COVID-19 Pandemic
description: The COVID-19 pandemic reaches the United States, leading to widespread lockdowns and economic disruption.

title: Capitol Riot
description: Supporters of President Trump storm the U.S. Capitol in an attempt to overturn the 2020 election results.
